gov.nih.nlm.ling.brat

Class StandoffAnnotationFileComparator

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nih.nlm.ling.brat.StandoffAnnotationFileComparator

  • public class StandoffAnnotationFileComparator
extends java.lang.Object
    The class to compare two standoff annotation files for evaluation purposes.
    Author:
    Halil Kilicoglu

    • Method Detail

      • compare

        public static void compare(java.lang.String id,
                           java.lang.String annFilename,
                           java.lang.String goldFilename,
                           java.util.Map<java.lang.String,StandoffAnnotationReader.AnnotationType> prefixMap,
                           java.util.List<java.lang.String> parseTypes,
                           java.util.List<java.lang.String> ignoreArgTypes,
                           boolean approximateMatch,
                           boolean useReference,
                           boolean matchUsedTermsOnly,
                           boolean evaluateSPAN,
                           java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<Annotation>> annoTP,
                           java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<Annotation>> annoFP,
                           java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<Annotation>> annoFN)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Compares two annotation files (only items with the types specified in parseTypes) and reports true positive, false positive and false negative annotations.
        Parameters:
        id - document id, presumably compared files have the same id
        annFilename - the first file to compare
        goldFilename - the second file to compare (or the gold file in the case of evaluation)
        prefixMap - a map that defines which prefix corresponds to which annotation type (e.g., 'T' -> 'Term'), if null, defaults are used
        parseTypes - the semantic types to compare
        ignoreArgTypes - the relation argument types to ignore in comparison (Cue, etc.), if any
        approximateMatch - whether to perform approximate span matching
        useReference - true if the term normalizations (CUIs, etc.) are to be used in matching terms
        matchUsedTermsOnly - true for only comparing TermAnnotation objects used in higher-level annotations
        evaluateSPAN - true if the unspecific SPAN term annotations can be used for partial term matching
        annoTP - returned true positive annotations keyed by the annotation type
        annoFP - returned false positive annotations
        annoFN - returned false negative annotations
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is a problem with reading annotation or gold standard files

      • compareTerms

        public static void compareTerms(java.util.Map<java.lang.Class,java.util.List<Annotation>> annotations1,
                                java.util.Map<java.lang.Class,java.util.List<Annotation>> annotations2,
                                boolean approximateMatch,
                                boolean matchUsedTermsOnly,
                                java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<Annotation>> annoTP,
                                java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<Annotation>> annoFP,
                                java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<Annotation>> annoFN)
        Compares TermAnnotation objects
        Parameters:
        annotations1 - all annotations from the first file
        annotations2 - all annotations from the second file
        approximateMatch - whether to use approximate matching
        matchUsedTermsOnly - true for only comparing TermAnnotation objects used in higher-level annotations
        annoTP - returned true positive annotations keyed by the annotation type
        annoFP - returned false positive annotations
        annoFN - returned false negative annotations

      • compareRelations

        public static void compareRelations(java.util.Map<java.lang.Class,java.util.List<Annotation>> annotations1,
                                    java.util.Map<java.lang.Class,java.util.List<Annotation>> annotations2,
                                    boolean approximateMatch,
                                    boolean useReference,
                                    boolean evaluateSPAN,
                                    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<Annotation>> annoTP,
                                    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<Annotation>> annoFP,
                                    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<Annotation>> annoFN)
        Compares RelationAnnotation objects
        Parameters:
        annotations1 - all annotations from the first file
        annotations2 - all annotations from the second file
        approximateMatch - whether to use approximate span matching
        useReference - true if term reference mappings are to be used in matching terms
        evaluateSPAN - true if sub-mentions of SPAN annotations are to be used in matching arguments
        annoTP - returned true positive annotations keyed by the annotation type
        annoFP - returned false positive annotations
        annoFN - returned false negative annotations
